Looks like an empty signature. Do you know why this might happen, Luc?

The only way that can happens if the VM sends an empty string as the JNI
signature of the variable. But this is not a valid case, a JNI signature is at
least one character.

It would be interresting to have a test case, but I think there no problem in
our code in this case.

Mark as wontfix.
The signature is empty because the VM sent an empty string, this is invalid.
We cannot handle the case because this method need to return a correct value
otherwise an other error will be generated later.
